Albert-László Barabási

Author of the Network Science book. Pioneered discoveries in network science and network medicine. Discovered the concept of scale-free networks and proposed the Barabási–Albert model, which explains the widespread emergence of such networks in natural, technological and social systems, including the World Wide Web and online communities.

  • Network Science Book: link
  • Emergence of scaling in random networks: Science ‘99
